content.description: Start seated with your right hand on the arete, and your left hand on the low block. Climb up using the left face features and the right arete features. Once you reach the top of the arete, move up towards the high lip. Top out really high with blind feat.
content.protection: You can get away with one pad (I prefer 2) but you need good spotters.
content.location: The right side of the southerly facing part of the boulder. Next to the Dickens.

content.description: My favorite V2 at The Pond. Stand start at head height jugs. Move up and right through the shallow left facing corner on good holds. Top out very high.
content.protection: The landing on this climb is not great due to some boulders. It is also a very tall problem, so I suggest 3 or 4 pads.
content.location: Right around the corner from Schtickums.

content.description:
Start sitting with two decent edges just right of the blunt arete, below an obvious vertical face. 

  Proceed more or less straight upwards via tricky footwork and small, painful crimps. The final reachy move can be a heartbreaker. 

  Finger strength and a high tolerance for pain are prerequisites for success on this climb. Despite the painful holds, this climb is quite good and worth trying!
content.location: This route is located to the left of 'Dickens'

content.description: Start crouched on a waist height horizontal bulge below a roof about 7 feet up. Climb up to the roof, make some really cool unique moves, and top out high above the roof.
content.location: Beneath the roof. From the Alien boulder, walk down a short little drop to a clearing. This is the prominent problem on this face.

content.description: 6 problems on this boulder. It is the boulder just downhill of the Alien boulder.
